revised_title: An Appraisal of the Newer Trace Elements in Animals and Human Health
tldr: This article reviews the evidence for the essentiality of newer trace elements, including vanadium, fluorine, silicon, nickel, and arsenic, in maintaining normal health in animals and humans. The authors discuss the criteria for establishing essentiality and the manifestations of deficiency states for each element. They also highlight the importance of further research to understand the roles and mechanisms of action of these trace elements in biological systems.
